intro: Cymbopetalum loretoyacuense, commonly known as the Loretoyacuense cymbopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lanceolate leaves that are dark green and glossy. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are usually pink or white and are clustered in inflorescences at the tips of the branches.
